channel.title: Spotted Peccary Music Podcast
channel.description: Music, News, Interviews, Unreleased material and more. Direct from one of the most respected Progressive/Ambient/Electronic/New Age independent record labels on the scene today.

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #37
item.description:
Spring is here once again. The trees & flowers are budding, and the birds & bees are out doing their thing. However, here at the podcast, we're always a few months behind the rest of the world, so we're going to explore two releases that came out a few months back...during the deep chill of winter. This episode features nearly an hour of music from "Dream In Blue" by Darshan Ambient, and "Synthetic Memories" by Justin Vanderberg.

Tracks:
(00:00) - Intro and Welcome (Music: "Mirage" by Darshan Ambient)
(02:18) - "The Path" from Synthetic Memories by Justin Vanderberg
(08:20) - "When Will My Someday Come" from Dream In Blue by Darshan Ambient
(12:28) - "When I Walk" from Synthetic Memories by Justin Vanderberg
(15:58) - "Upon Reflection" from Dream In Blue by Darshan Ambient
(21:27) - "Synthetic Memories" from Synthetic Memories by Justin Vanderberg
(32:37) - "Dream In Blue" from Dream In Blue by Darshan Ambient
(37:54) - "Cold Brightness" from Synthetic Memories by Justin Vanderberg
(45:47) - "Sun Fade" from Dream In Blue by Darshan Ambient
(51:03) - Wrap up, contact info and thanks! (Music: "Drops" by Justin Vanderberg)
(53:45) - "Silent Smile (Angelo's Song)" from Dream In Blue by Darshan Ambient

feedback:
podcast@musicisart.com

Contact!
MySpace: http://www.myspace.com/miapodcast
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/spottedpeccary
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/spottedpeccary

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #36
item.description:
Falling leaves and falling rain have us deeply inspired by the turning of the season. This episode features epic electronics from Paul Ellis' latest release on the Lotuspike label, "From Out Of The Vast Comes Nearness," with interludes from Erik Wollo's new double live CD on Projekt Records, "Silent Currents."

Tracks:
(00:00) - Intro and Welcome (Music: "Watch The Stars Come One By One" by Paul Ellis)
(04:06) - "Silent Currents 1, pt.2" from Silent Currents by Erik Wollo
(07:38) - "The Infinite Minute By Minute" from From Out of the Vast Comes Nearness by Paul Ellis
(16:41) - "Silent Currents 2, pt.13" from Silent Currents by Erik Wollo
(20:14) - "The Click and Chime of Passing Time" from From Out of the Vast Comes Nearness by Paul Ellis
(32:20) - "Silent Currents 1, pt.5" from Silent Currents by Erik Wollo
(36:49) - "Firefly Rising Outshined By The Moon" from From Out of the Vast Comes Nearness by Paul Ellis
(49:16) - Wrap up, contact info and thanks! (Music: "Silent Currents 2, pt.4" by Erik Wollo)

feedback:
podcast@musicisart.com

Contact!

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/spottedpeccary
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/spottedpeccary

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #35
item.description:
Up to date.....almost.

The final installment of our three-part series covering all the new releases from the label in the past year. This should bring everything up to.....hang on.....wait a minute....what's that? There has been another new release since the last podcast? OK, so we'll call this the "Almost Caught Up On The New Releases" podcast. - featuring deep sounds from Bruno Sanfilippo and Time Being.

Tracks:
(00:00) - Intro and Welcome (Music: "The Third Geometry" by Bruno Sanfilippo)
(03:34) - "Santa Luminosa" from Subliminal Pulse by Bruno Sanfilippo
(09:40) - "As You Pass This Way" from A Dimension Reflected by Time Being
(19:28) - "Slipped Time" from Subliminal Pulse by Bruno Sanfilippo
(25:07) - "Dust Of Sorts" from A Dimension Reflected by Time Being
(33:46) - "Subliminal Pulse" from Subliminal Pulse by Bruno Sanfilippo
(39:00) - "Static Flow" from A Dimension Reflected by Time Being
(45:21) - "Spirit Allies" from Subliminal Pulse by Bruno Sanfilippo
(50:38) - Wrap up, contact info and thanks! (Music: "In The Care Of Knowing" by Time Being)
(53:06) - "Mantram" from Subliminal Pulse by Bruno Sanfilippo

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #34
item.description:
You're Still Out There!

What a huge response to the last podcast. You're still out there listening and you let us know it big time! Thank you for that. On this edition we continue playing catch up - featuring recent releases from the Lotuspike label with a solid blend of tracks by Darshan Ambient and Johan Agebjorn.

Tracks:
(00:00) - Intro and Welcome (Music: "Spacer Woman From Mars" by Johan Agebjorn)
(02:54) - "One Moon Shows In Every Pool" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient
(09:01) - "Take Me Home" from The Mountain Lake by Johan Agebjorn
(13:48) - "Now Sleeps The Crimson Petal" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient
(19:23) - "Swimming Through The Blue Lagoon" from The Mountain Lake by Johan Agebjorn
(24:03) - "The Dreamer Slept But Did Not Dream" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient
(27:56) - "Amylium Casparium (with Neon Coil)" from The Mountain Lake by Johan Agebjorn
(32:42) - "Talking Book" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient
(39:22) - "Love Ray" from The Mountain Lake by Johan Agebjorn (w/Lisa Barra)
(43:00) - "A Deeper Blue" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient
(49:33) - Wrap up, contact info and thanks! (Music: "Siberian Train (remix)" by Johan Agebjorn)
(53:30) - "The Long Rain" from A Day Within Days by Darshan Ambient

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #33
item.description:
Some Serious Catching Up To Do

OK, so it's been over six months since our last podcast. And in that six months, the record label has released six, count'em SIX new albums. So over the next few podcasts, we will covering all the new stuff and bringing everything up to date starting here with podcast 33, which will feature music from the multi award winning "The Crossing" by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins, and the special remastered edition of "Deep Roots, Hidden Water" by Deborah Martin.

Tracks:
(00:00) - Intro and Welcome (Music: "Deep Roots Hidden Water" by Deborah Martin)
(02:51) - "From The Smallest Seed" from THE CROSSING by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins
(08:11) - "Crossing Plateau" from DEEP ROOTS HIDDEN WATER (remastered) by Deborah Martin
(13:31) - "The Same Sky" from THE CROSSING by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins
(18:49) - "One Sun" from DEEP ROOTS HIDDEN WATER (remastered) by Deborah Martin
(22:50) - "The Lesson" from THE CROSSING by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins
(29:19) - "The Strength Of Stones" from DEEP ROOTS HIDDEN WATER (remastered) by Deborah Martin
(34:03) - "Two Paths" from THE CROSSING by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins
(40:48) - Wrap up, contact info and thanks! (Music: "The Brilliance Of Stars" by Deborah Martin)
(44:50) - "To The Ends Of The Earth" from THE CROSSING by David Helpling and Jon Jenkins

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #30
item.description:
LOTUSPIKE'S LATEST

We took some time off from podacst production for a while, and while we were away two new Lotuspike releases hit the streets. This edition of the podcast features music from "Wanderlust" by Terra Ambient and "Virga" by Jeff Greinke. Plus an excerpt from Steve Roach's new 72 minute masterpeice, "Destination Beyond."

Tracks:

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #26
item.description:
Peccary Podcast #26
December 2008

MUSIC FROM THE LATEST RELEASES

Is it possible to create a cohesive podcast only using music from two very different sounding CDs? Listen and judge for yourself. Music from DESERT REALMS by Rudy Adrian, and HEAVEN AND EARTH by John Gregorius.

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #24
item.description:
LOST EPISODE


July 2006
A Lost Episode from the Streets of Taipei


***NOTE***
This podcast has accompanying images that cannot be seen in the normal mp3. To get the enhanced version with the included images, please visit www.MusicIsArt.com and subscribe to the podcast through iTunes...it's free!
*************


This podcast was recorded in July 2006 from Taipei, Taiwan, but never made it as a finished episode for the podcast feed. When I returned from the trip, my computer had a major meltdown and was out two weeks for repairs, so this episode was never completed. However, since we are currently completely swamped with some big projects and having trouble finding the time to do a new podcast, we thought we'd let you hear this Lost Episode. A "sound-seeing" journey from July 2006 through the streets of Taipei in Taiwan.



Tracks:
• "Adrift" from CONTINUUM by Jon Jenkins and Paul Lackey
• "Mysteries Of The Mountains" from ANNAPURNA: THE TOWERING SKY by Mark Hunton
• "Night Lights" from iTUNES EXCLUSIVES by Erik Wollo
• "Palace" from TIBET by Deborah Martin and Cheryl Gallagher

feedback: podcast@musicisart.com

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #21
item.description:
Music for a Long Winter's Nap

Yesterday was the shortest day of the year and today we enter the final season, so here is a set of music to enjoy during the long nights of winter...

• Autumn Continent 1 from the CD Autumn Continent, by Between Interval
• The Brilliance of Stars - from the CD Deep Roots, Hidden Water, by Deborah Martin
• Frost - from the CD Wind Journey, by Erik Wollo
• Chrysoden - from the CD Fluxus Quo , by Greg Klamt
• Winter Nights - from the CD Not Far From A Distant Sun, by Brain Laughter
• Night Drifting Through Black Canyon - from the CD Flow, by Jon Jenkins
• Place of Grace - from the CD Painting Twilight, by Mark Rownd
• Vostok - from the CD Vostok, by Craig Padilla
• End of an Era - from the CD Between Green and Blue, by David Helpling

David Helpling & Jon Jenkins

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #12
item.description:
David Helpling.

David Helpling and Jon Jenkins take a break from working on their upcoming collaboration, Treasure, to do a podcast from David's studio, "Deep Exile". Topics include music, movies, the current collaboration project, and what David has been up to since the release of Sleeping on the Edge of the World in 1999. Lots of unreleased material to hear in this one!!

Tracks:
0:00 • Unreleased work in progress by David Helpling & Jon Jenkins
6:27 • "A Cool Bath" (unreleased) from the COLD STORAGE soundtrack by David Helpling
8:33 • "The Ring, The Road" from the unreleased TAFT soundtrack by David Helpling
10:15 • "In From The Rain" from the unreleased TAFT soundtrack by David Helpling
12:30 • "Sapna Cries Alone" from the CD TRADE OFFS by David Helpling
14:48 • Unreleased work in progress by David Helpling & Jon Jenkins
33:48 • Unreleased work in progress by David Helpling & Jon Jenkins
40:14 • Unreleased work in progress by David Helpling & Jon Jenkins

feedback: podcast@musicisart.com

Visit David Helpling online: davidhelpling.com & dhmmusicdesign.com

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #11
item.description:
The long overdue 11th installment of the MUSIC IS ART podcast.

This is a music only show which focuses on the Pittsburgh based Lotuspike label.

Tracks from Darshan Ambient, Ben Cox, Chad Hoefler, and Terra Ambient.
All of the music in this podcast is played with permission from the label.

Thanks to the folks at Lotuspike!
Visit them online at www.lotuspike.com

Tracks:
• "Deep Garden" from the CD AUTUMN'S APPLE by Darshan Ambient
• "Westerly Prayer" from the CD THE GATE by Terra Ambient
• "Pray For Rain" from the CD ON WATER by Ben Cox
• "Bending Chromatic Light" from the CD QUIET GLOW by Chad Hoefler
• "A Walk Along The Ganges" from the CD RE:KARMA by Darshan Ambient

feedback: podcast@musicisart.com

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #10
item.description:
This podcast was recorded on March 2, 2006. But since I was on the road and my five year old iBook couldn't handle the file creation process, I was unable to post it until now. Guess it's time for a new MacBook Pro!!

A "sound-seeing" journey with Jon Jenkins through the streets of Rotterdam in The Netherlands. All of the music in this podcast is by Erik Wollo and Paul Ellis & Craig Padilla, and is played with permission from Netherlands based label, Groove Records. Bedankt!! Visit them online at www.groove.nl

Tracks:
• "Expedition" from THE POLAR DRONES by Erik Wollo
• "Windy Plains" from ECHO SYSTEM by Paul Ellis and Craig Padilla
• "Writing On Water" (excerpt) from ECHO SYSTEM by Paul Ellis and Craig Padilla
• "Glacier Blue" from THE POLAR DRONES by Erik Wollo

feedback: podcast@musicisart.com

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #9
item.description:
A Music Only Show

February 9, 2006

Pressed for time today, but wanted to get a new podcast out...

This is a music only show...enjoy!

• Did anybody see Coldplay at the Grammys perform the song "Talk", which is their version of "Computer Love"?
• Computer Love - from the CD Blue Sky, Red Guitars, by Erik Wøllo
• Mysteries of the Mountains - from the CD Annapurna: The Towering Sky, by Mark Hunton
• Hermetica - from the CD From a Distant Horizon, by J. Arif Verner
• Divine Whisper - from the CD Sleeping on the Edge of the World, by David Helpling
• Over 12 hours of continuous streaming music 24 hours a day on our Live365 station.
• - ~ Background music: The Dream - from the CD The Storm , by Michael Stearns
• Where is the Northern Sorrow? - from the CD Salvaging The Past, by Dean De Benedictis

feedback: podcast@musicisart.com

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #8
item.description:
Mmmmm...Coffee!

Happy 2006 to all.
Hope you don't mind us having a little fun with this one!

• Exclusive unreleased "work in progress" from Green Isac
• (((Beginning of subliminal programming)))
• Starbucks card...it's like free coffee!
• (((End of subliminal programming)))
• Between The Divide - from the CD From A Distant Horizon, by J. Arif Verner
• Reality check
• Share The Secret (The News)
• No Golden Globe, but Amazon.com likes us!
• Lower shipping option and lower CD prices at the webstore.
• Download THE NEW WORLD featurette in HD
• Wind Journey 2 - from the CD Wind Journey, by Erik Wøllo
• Wrap up...looking back & looking forward.
• Tom Griesgraber & Andy Summers concert Feb 10th: discount tickets.
• Another exclusive unreleased "work in progress" from Green Isac

Listen

item.title: Spotted Peccary's MUSIC IS ART - #7
item.description:
If you are using iTunes to listen to podcasts, we highly recommend that you subscribe to the iTunes feed for the enhanced podcast. That way you can enjoy the images, chapters and clickable links that accompany this program.

A conversation with Steve Roach:

One of ambient music's great masterpeices is Steve Roach's Dreamtime Return. Since its release in 1988, Dreamtime Return has earned its reputation as a genuine classic. The two-CD Magnum Opus is perhaps the most important, widely known and highly respected release in Steve Roach’s vast body of work, it serves as an essential benchmark within the Ambient-Ethno-Atmospheric genre.

Steve Roach joins us in a conversation about his recent experience remastering Dreamtime Return, shares insight into it's creation and how it affected him, the creative process, the music business in general, and much more.

All background music is from the new Dreamtime Box which includes:

• Dreamtime Return (2005 remastered edition) 2CDs
• New Life Dreaming
• Possible Planet

item.title: The Spotted Peccary MUSIC IS ART Podcast #5 - July 28th, 2005
item.description:
The Spotted Peccary MUSIC IS ART Podcast - #5

A conversation with Chapman Stick master Tom Griesgraber and legendary drummer Jerry Marotta
Marotta & Griesgraber will be touring the west coast with Erik Wollo beginning August 5th.

• Quick NEW WORLD update.
• New "Enhanced Podcast" for iTunes...here is the feed:
http://www.spottedpeccary.com/itunes/itunesfeed.xml

Tracks Played:
In A Step - from the unreleased CD Waking The Day, by Marotta/Griesgraber
Waking The Day- Live rehersal in Tom's Living Room
 Lowered Skies - from the unreleased CD Waking The Day, by Marotta/Griesgraber
Jungle - from the CD A Whisper In The Thunder, by Tom Griesgraber

Listen
